case.name: Walker v Body Logic Resources Pty Ltd [2008] FCA 1086 (23 July 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: discretion of court if applicant ordinarily resident outside australia
no evidence of any assets within the jurisdiction
no evidence of assets in foreign jurisdiction where judgment may be registered in future
federal court of australia act 1976 (cth) s 56
application to review asc decision to apply to corporations and securities panel for declaration of unacceptable circumstances s 733(1)

consideration of the disposition of the costs in relation to the respondent's motion for security for costs cases cited: newtimber (operations) pty ltd v tarong energy corporation limited [2011] fca 123
cited and quoted walker v body logic resources [2008] fca 1086
cited and quoted o'keeffe nominees pty ltd v bp australia ltd and another (no. 2) [1995] fca 1079 ; (1995) 55 fcr 591
cited and quoted scherer v counting instruments ltd (1986) 2 all er 529
cited and quoted moussa v commonwealth bank of australia [2011] fca 67
cited burgess v centrelink & ors [2007] fca 595 ; (2007) 159 fcr 500

citances.sentence: NOPL contends that the costs of and incidental to the notice of motion ought to be reserved on the footing that, in the circumstances, neither party could be said to have been entirely successful on the hearing of the motion; consistently with the decision of Buchanan J in Walker v Body Logic Resources [2008] FCA 1086 , it is not appropriate to make a separate order for costs until the determination of the merits in the principal proceeding; and, the notice of motion was scheduled for a day on which the matter was listed for directions and thus Tarong and NOPL would necessarily have been appearing before the Court in any event.
